com.jeanchampemont.gunip

Class GenericUnitParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jeanchampemont.gunip.GenericUnitParser
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryByteParser, DecimalByteParser, DurationParser, ImperialDistanceParser, MetricDistanceParser

    public class GenericUnitParser
extends Object
    A Generic Unit Parser is a natural language parser to parse strings containing a sequence of tuples (value, unit), and convert it into a single value in a base unit. For example, if you define the following units:
    • Base unit: mm, millimeter
    • Centimeter (cm): 10mm
    • Meter (mtr, m): 1000mm
    • Kilometer (kmtr, km): 1000000mm
    Parsing the following string: 
                    1 kmtr, 10m and 28cm, 12millimeter
    will give you the following result: 
                    1 * 1000000 + 10 * 1000 + 28 * 10 + 12 = 1010292mm
    A Generic Unit Parser is flexible enough to understand several symbols for a unit (second(s), sec, s) and ignore punctuation and stop words. Pre-built unit parsers are available. DurationParser, MetricDistanceParser and ImperialDistanceParser

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenericUnitParser(List<Unit> units)
      Creates a new Generic Unit Parser with the specified units table.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenericUnitParser

        public GenericUnitParser(List<Unit> units)
        Creates a new Generic Unit Parser with the specified units table. The first unit in the list (index 0) is considered to be the base unit. For an example of a units table, please see DurationParser.DurationParser()
        Parameters:
        units - The units table

        public double parse(String str)
        Parse a string containing a sequence of tuples (value, unit) and convert it into a single value in a base unit.
        Parameters:
        str - the string to parse
        Returns:
        the value of the string in the base unit
